lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* Parser class parses user input and provides static utility functions to parse miscellaneous strings.
* Parses user input obtained from Scanner, and returns a Command that depends on the user input.
* Certain commands will trigger validation to ensure that the command arguments are valid.
* @param fullCommand Unparsed user input obtained from scanner.
* @return Command object to be executed later.
* @throws DukeException Occurs when an error occurs during parsing, such as invalid arguments.
public static Command parseInput(String fullCommand) throws DukeException {
* Given a string, return true if it is a valid common.COMMANDS enum.
* @param str String to check if the enum exists.
* @return True if the provided string is a valid common.COMMANDS enum.
* Given a string and a DateTime format, validate if the given string
* @param str    The string to be validated against.
* @param format The format the string should follow.
* @return Boolean representing if str follows the specified format.
public static boolean isValidDatetime(String str, String format) {
* Splits an array into subarrays at a given delimiter, and concatenates the substrings.
* For example, given ['a', 'b', '\n', 'c', 'd'], with the delimiter specified to be '\n',
* the function splits the array at '\n' and concatenates the split subarrays to return
* @param arr       Array of strings to be split
* @param delimiter Array is split into two subarrays at the delimiter,
*                  and each subarray's elements are concatenated with a " " between each element
public static List<String> splitArrayIntoSubstrings(String[] arr, String delimiter) {
* Utility class that handles reading and writing from an external storage (.txt) file.
* @param storageName    Name of storage file. Should be a .txt file.
* @param storageDirName Name of directory storing the storage file.
* Attempts to create a directory and/or storage file if it does not exist.
* @throws IOException Thrown when an error creating the storage file occurs.
* Writes a given task list to storage, with the delimiter used being "#".
* @param taskList Task list to save to storage.
* Reads from an existing storage file and populates an empty TaskList object with Task objects
* @param taskList The TaskList object to populate.
* @throws IOException Thrown when reading errors occur.
public void readFromStorage(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
Scanner s = new Scanner(f); // create a Scanner using the File as the source
* Utility class that handles printing to terminal and reading user input.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Duke!\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Prints the prompt to obtain user command.
* Reads the user input and returns a String representation.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Formats and prints the contents of a given TaskList object.
* Prints the flavour text when marking a task.
System.out.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done: %s\n", task);
* Prints the flavour text when marking a task.
System.out.format("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: %s\n", task);
* Prints the flavour text when adding a task.
* @param taskList Current task list after task is added.
public static void printAddTask(Task task, TaskList taskList) {

System.out.format("Got it. I've added this task:
  %s
Now you have %s %s in the list.
", task, taskList.size(), taskList.size() != 1 ? "tasks" : "task");
* Prints the flavour text when deleting a task.
* @param taskList Current task list after task is added.
public static void printDeleteTask(Task task, TaskList taskList) {

System.out.format("Noted. I've removed this task:
 %s
Now you have %s %s in the list.
", task, taskList.size(), taskList.size() != 1 ? "tasks" : "task");
* Prints flavour text for creating new directory.
System.out.printf("Creating new directory '%s' to store data...\n", dirName);
* Prints flavour text for creating new storage file.
System.out.printf("Creating new file '%s' to store data...\n", storageName);
* Prints flavour text for saving task list to storage file.
* Prints the task list where tasks matches a given target.
System.out.printf("Here are the matching tasks in your list: \n");
* Duke is a CLI-program that allows users to perform CRUD operations
* on user-defined tasks. These are saved to an external storage (txt file).
* Initializes Duke by attempting to load from storage (or creating storage if it does not exist),
* and print relevant items to terminal.
* Shuts down Duke by saving task list to storage, and printing out relevant items to terminal.
* Loop that is called to receive and process user input.
* A generic Exception class for Duke to be inherited by Exception subclasses.
* Thrown when a provided index for a list or array is illegal (out of bounds) or
super("The index provided is illegal, or not an int.");
* Thrown when a function in a parent class that shouldn't be directly called and instead be
* called from a child class is called.
* @param s String for the function's name.
super(String.format("%s should not be used and should be overridden!", s));
* Thrown when there is insufficient arguments provided to a function.
* Thrown when there is a missing description passed to a Task object.
* @param command The name of the Task.
super(String.format("OOPS!!! The description of a %s cannot be empty.", command));
* Thrown when an unknown command (e.g. "blah") is passed into duke.Duke. Commands are
super("OOPS!!! Sorry, I do not know what that means!");
* Thrown when a string does not follow a specified datetime format during validation.
* A string is passed to the constructor to specify the correct datetime format to follow.
* @param format The format for the string to follow.
super(String.format("Wrong date and time format provided! Please enter it in this format: %s", format));
* Utility class that handles CRUD operations regarding the task list in memory.
* Deletes a task at a specified (zero-indexed) index in the task
* list, and returns the deleted task.
* Case where list is empty should be guarded against.
* @param index Index of task to be deleted, zero-indexed
* Returns true if the task list is empty.
* @return Boolean value representing if the task list is empty.
* Tasks.Deadline represents a Tasks.Task with a deadline represented as a single LocalDateTime object.
* @param by              LocalDateTime representation of the deadline.
* @param isComplete      Whether the Deadline is completed.
* @param by              LocalDateTime representation of the deadline.
public Deadline(String taskDescription, boolean isComplete, LocalDateTime by) {
* Returns the encoded representation of the current Deadline to be saved to an external storage.
* @return String representation of current Deadline for saving to Storage.
* Returns string representation of Deadline to be printed to terminal.
* @return Returns string representation of Deadline to be printed to terminal.
* Tasks.Event represents a Tasks.Task with a start and end datetime. These are represented as
public Event(String taskDescription, LocalDateTime startDateTime, LocalDateTime endDateTime) {
* @param isComplete      Whether or not the Event is complete.
public Event(String taskDescription, boolean isComplete, LocalDateTime startDateTime, LocalDateTime endDateTime) {
* Returns the encoded representation of the current Event to be saved to an external storage.
* @return String representation of current Event for saving to Storage.
return String.format("[E]#%s#%s#%s#%s", getTaskDescription(), getIsComplete(), formattedStartDateTime, formattedEndDateTime);
* Returns string representation of Event to be printed to terminal.
* @return Returns string representation of Event to be printed to terminal.
return String.format("[E] %s (at: %s to %s)", super.toString(), formattedStartDateTime, formattedEndDateTime);
* Tasks.Task represents a generic task that subclasses can inherit from. Represents
* something that needs to be done.
* This class should not be used on its own, but inherited by other subclasses and
private boolean isComplete = false; // Initialized to false by default
* Abstract function to be overridden representing a Task's internal representation
* @return String representing internal representation of a Task.
* Returns whether a Task is completed.
* @return Boolean representing if a Task is complete.
* Sets the completion state of a Task.
* @param completedStatus Boolean representing if the Task is complete.
* Returns string representation of the Task. Should be overridden in child
* ToDo represents a Tasks.Task without any datetime objects associated with it.
* Returns the encoded representation of the current ToDo to be saved to an external storage.
* @return String representation of current ToDo for saving to Storage.
* Returns string representation of ToDo to be printed to terminal.
* @return Returns string representation of ToDo to be printed to terminal.
private final ByteArrayOutputStream outContent = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
private final ByteArrayOutputStream errContent = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
